name: keybinder
author: Gregorio Litenstein <g.litenstein@gmail.com>
title: Keybinder
description: Enables customization and overriding of several default shortcuts.

preferences.name: overridePluginFocus
preferences.title: Steal focus from plug-ins?
preferences.description: When this is on, plugins such as Flash will be told to release mouse focus a certain amount of time after they have been clicked on.

preferences.name: shiftAllowFocus
preferences.title: Allow plug-ins to keep focus on Shift+Click?
preferences.description: When this is on, plugins such as Flash will be allows to retain mouse focus if Shift was pressed during the click.

preferences.name: UrlPatternsDialog
preferences.label: Edit
preferences.title: Address Patterns
preferences.description: Edit address patterns used to define the websites on which we'll force plug-ins to release focus. Valid patterns are full URLs and domain names with or without '*' as a wildcard. Only one * allowed per URL, the add-on will automatically remove invalid entries from the list.

preferences.name: ShortcutsDialog
preferences.label: Change
preferences.title: Shortcut Mappings
preferences.description: Open the main extension dialog, which will allow you to edit or disable most application shortcuts.

preferences.name: pluginCssSelectors
preferences.title: List of CSS Selectors by which to find plugins
preferences.description: This list will define which plugins the extension will try to override as described above.

preferences.name: pluginCrawlLimit
preferences.title: Retry Limit
preferences.description: Some sites use javascript to add flash after everything is loaded, in these cases we need to rescan the page when a change in the structure is detected. This determines the maximum number of items this should be allowed per page. Default is 5 times.

preferences.name: stealFocusDelay
preferences.title: Focus Blur Delay
preferences.description: This value corresponds to the amount of time (in milliseconds) before plugins are told to release mouse focus. Default is 5 seconds.

preferences.name: allowCustomXULKeys
preferences.title: Allow Custom XUL keys
preferences.description: Turn this on to be able to create entirely new XUL keys, which can later be used to create entirely new custom mappings. WARNING: Using this feature requires some knowledge of the browser internals; don't use it unless you know what you are doing or you risk breaking something inside Firefox.

preferences.name: keysMapDirty
preferences.title: Dirty Keys Map
preferences.description: If this value is true, we should ignore the cache and rebuild the list of Keys from scratch. (Used when enabling/disabling the Custom XUL keys functionality)

preferences.name: customXULDialog
preferences.label: Change
preferences.title: Custom XUL Keys
preferences.description: Open the main extension dialog, which will allow you to edit or disable most application shortcuts.
